basics.name: Kaustubh Ponkshe
basics.label: AI Researcher
basics.summary: A dedicated researcher specializing in federated learning, privacy-preserving AI, and efficient model fine-tuning, with experience at prestigious institutions including MIT Media Lab and MBZUAI.

highlights: Ranked third among the entire batch in the Artificial Intelligence and Data Science Programme
Completed a minor degree in Computer Science & Engineering
Secured perfect grade (AA) in every course from Mathematics & Statistics Department

work.name: Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence
work.summary: Working on LoRA-SB and FedEx-LoRA projects under Prof. Praneeth Vepakomma
highlights: Developed novel initialization strategy for low-rank adaptation
Achieved 90x parameter reduction while matching performance
Formulated systematic error residual assignment for federated LoRA

work.name: MIT Media Lab, Camera Culture Group
work.summary: Worked on Power-Learning project focusing on differentially private embeddings
highlights: Established theoretical conditions for private data distribution
Achieved 5% improvement over DP-SGD while maintaining privacy guarantees
Developed joint learning framework for privacy-utility optimization

work.name: AWL Inc. Japan
highlights: Implemented parallel processing for face detection and classification
Developed three graph-based optimization algorithms

publications.name: Initialization using Update Approximation for Extremely Efficient Low-Rank Fine-tuning
Power Learning: Differentially private embeddings for collaborative learning
FedEx-LoRA: Exact Aggregation for Federated Fine-Tuning of Foundation Models

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Award (URA 02)
awards.summary: Awarded for one of the best bachelor's thesis in the entire batch

projects.name: LoRA-SB
projects.description: Novel initialization strategy for efficient low-rank adaptation
highlights: 90x parameter reduction while maintaining performance
Theoretical guarantees for gradient optimization
Applied to models up to 9B parameters

projects.name: GUIDEQ
projects.description: Framework for guided questioning using LLMs and XAI
highlights: Novel occlusion-based method for keyword identification
Improved F1-scores through enhanced information collection
Applied to healthcare and legal domains
Designed autonomous controller for FSSIM simulation
Won Software Intelligence competition by Ather Energy
Implemented dynamic control systems
Organized Blackcat Championship for varsity teams
Executed Virtual Run with 1500+ participants
